subject: Gardening
title: The Eden Project: Biomes in a Crater
description: A quick, practical guide to The Eden Project: Biomes in a Crater.

hook.text: Cornwall's Eden Project built the world's largest indoor rainforest inside a disused clay pit.

buildup.text: Two massive geodesic domesâ€”biomesâ€”house over a million plants from tropical and Mediterranean climates.

discovery.text: The Rainforest Biome reaches 55 meters high and maintains tropical humidity year-round in English weather.

twist.text: Eden was built as an educational tool, not a pleasure garden. Its mission is teaching humans about plant dependence.

climax.text: The Eden Project turned a scar in the landscape into a living lesson about humanity's debt to the plant world.

punchline.text: A clay pit became a cathedral for plant worship.

quiz.question: What is the Eden Project's primary mission?
options: Breeding rare tropical plants for commercial sale
Teaching humans about their dependence on the plant world
Providing a tropical vacation destination in England
